Posts.Content: Thanks Helen I really thought I'd made a huge mistake.  As I said I'm not very good with any type of technology ha ha.  I'm so pleased I've found this site since my treatment finished I've been totally alone.  I'm seeing my oncologist in 6 months but that's my only contact.  However I've opted for reconstruction and I'm seeing the surgeon in March,  Love shirl xxx
Posts.Title: Pain in joints and muscles

Posts.Content: Hi everyone thank you so much for for. Replying so quickly.  It's nice to know I'm not the only one suffering with these pains. I've made a huge mistake I've put my history with cancer on my profile not realising that this is where I should have put it ha ha I'm not very good with technology it took me ages to find this today. My name is shirl I was diagnosed with breast cancer after having a chest X-ray in October 2014.  I was put on Fec 2 once every 3 weeks but another lump came through just after my 3 rd cycle.  I ended up having a bilateral double mastectomy during op a 3rd lump was found.  The last 2 lumps were found to be much more aggressive than the first one.  I was put on doxitaxol but couldn't tolerate it at all ended up in hospital with neutropenic sepsis I was there for a week and had these same pains.  I started a new treatment paxiataxol I had that every week for 12 weeks.  All treatment finished October/November 2015.  I've just had my 3 month check up and my oncologist sent me for a bone scan I am still awaiting results.  I am not on any tablets for cancer as mine was her2 negative and didn't respond to hormone treatments that's why all the chemo, Drs and me hoping that it is enough. I hope this helps you understand my situation a bit better.  Thanks shirl
Posts.Title: Pain in joints and muscles

Posts.Content: Hi this is my first time on here but really need your advice.  I finished my chemo 4 months ago but just before my last session I started experiencing aches and pains.  I have mentioned it to my GP and the oncologist but to be honest I'm not sure I'm being diagnosed properly.  Pain is a personal thing and I know it's hard for Drs to diagnose as pain thresholds vary from person to person.  I've just had a bone scan and I am awaiting results although the dr thinks it could be rheumatism but I thought it only affects joints.  My GP thinks it could be side effects from chemo but I don't have any tingling or numbness.  The pain I have is some times very debilitating that I can't get up out of bed or a chair.  My joints become stiff that at first I can't walk properly but after awhile it wears off.  I'm having a bad day today as I'm typing this my hands and fingers are hurting, I also have pain in my hips legs and all of my upper arms.  My arms are painful even when touched.  I am now on Fentanyl patches 50mcg but they aren't helping.  The strange thing is some days the pain has gone and I feel quite well?   I'm sorry this is so long but I could really do with some help and advice.
